title: Migrating to a new Windows laptop has affected IMAP
content:
G'day from 'Straya!

I have migrated Thunderbird from one Windows laptop to another, copying the profile and all included files. This mostly worked but has created a couple of issues I am trying to troubleshoot and could really use some help.

First thing probably worth noting is that I had an earlier version of Thunderbird on the old laptop than the new one downloaded to the new laptop. I don't that if that is the problem.

I have two email accounts which are both using IMAP. When I delete an email in Thunderbird, it keeps coming back and I now have multiple copies of that email. My storage is filling up ðŸ˜’ Is there a setting I am missing?

Additionally, the migration does not seem to have brought over my contacts. Did I miss something?

Any help and advice will be greatly appreciated.
creator: martianfj+firefox

title: Updated to Nebula and now my Gmail account doesn't work
content: Thunderbird just updated to this new Nebula version and now my Gmail account isn't working. I have other accounts setup and they seem to still work (Outlook based) It sits there trying to sync my calendar or I get Checking mail server capabilities. It also doesn't shutdown when I exit Thunderbird. What is going on?

title: Sending Emails to an address book list
content: I have prepared a new list in my address book of 36 addresses. I called it Signatures 2024. I tried to send the emails and it won't send and I have received a note "Invalid Recipient Address. Signatures 2024 is not a valid email address because it is not of the form user@host. You must correct it before sending." I have done similar many times in the past with success so do not know what to do. It is urgent that I get this email out. Regards Bevan Lawrence
creator: lhlaw

title: Message list backgrounds colours to match accounts
content:
Is it possible to give each email account a color and have the message list backgrounds match the account colors? It would make it much easier to know which account has received the email when viewing the Unified Folders Inbox. I think this used to be possible with an extension called 'account colors' but it no longer works in 128.

I have noticed that I can change the account icon colors (r.click account > Properties) but it doesn't translate to the message list.

Thanks for your help.
creator: oliwally1

title: missing address books
content: Hi, I've recently managed to re-install version 102.15.1 on my laptops and desktop as I hated 115 with a passion. I'd also had microsoft making my life hell with their OAUTH and cookies shenanigans. I could only access my outlook/hotmail accounts by using outlook in a browser which I really hate and is why I started using Thunderbird years ago. Anyhoo, since I managed to install 102.15.1 again and sort out microsofts problem I've found that my address books have disappeared. I've seen answers to other peoples problems mentioning profiles etc. but that just baffles me. I just want my address books back, ( both collected and personal ) as it makes it so much easier when addressing emails to just type the first couple of letters and then choose from the results rather than having to ytype the complete address. So if any can help I'll really appreciate it, Thanks. Alf J alf.j.slawson@outlook.com
creator: Alf.J

title: CANNOT DOWN LOAD EMAILS USING THUNDERBIRDS
content: I have successfully used Thunderbirds for 10 years on my 2013 Mac BookPro. During the last 6 months I've had a number of instances when Thunderbirds could not connect with the server. As of the 16 Sept 2024 this has method has not been successful and I have had to resort to Mail on my iPad. This is not very satisfactory as all history and contacts are with Thunderbirds. I need a solution to login to my Thunderbirds account. I've not changed any settings or passwords. I'm running Norton 360 security on all computers in this household and have for 15 years. HELP!!!!!

title: Emails lost after repairing corrupt inbox
content:
Iâ€™ve been using Thunderbird for quite a few years now but recently out of the blue I noticed that all emails starting from 2000 to a few weeks ago show up blank when opened. After googling this issue I found someone who suggested I repair the inbox in Thunderbird (right click and repair), which I did. However now all those mails that first showed up blank are completely missing from my inbox. I know theyâ€™re still there because when I search for them Thunderbird can find them and even shows the first few sentences of the email. But when I attempt to open them theyâ€™re empty again.

It seems to be an indexing issue, which Iâ€™ve tried to resolve by removing the indexing file (to a different location just in case). Then starting up Thunderbird again to rebuild the file, sadly this did not resolve the issue.

Normally I would just re-sync these emails from online, however due to an issue with my mail provider these are no longer available there.

I know the emails are still there stored locally, but I canâ€™t access them anymore.

Can anyone help?

My mail account uses POP

title: Remove e-mail from Corespondents column
content:
Win 365 desktop, Thunderbird 128.2.2esr (64-bit) -- all updates current.

With the last update every e-mail displays both the name and e-mail of the sender in the Corespondents column of the inbox and other folders. While I understand the security value of this I find it much more difficult to read. They become very long and cluttered. Is there any setting I can change to make the e-mail part not display?

Even better would be a setting or update where the sender name and e-mail are separate columns.
creator: gatekat

title: PERDITA MAIL DI UN SOLO ACCOUNT
content: La settimana scorsa, al mio rientro dalle ferie e prima riaccensione del pc, ho rilevato di avere perso tutte le mail relative alla mia PEC, purtroppo unica configurata POP e non IMAP. Ho provato ad utilizzare il mio ultimo backup senza risolvere. Inutile dire che non ho effettuato di mia azione diretta alcuna cancellazione. Ho controllato nel sito internet della PEC, ma purtroppo, trattandosi di configurazione POP, sono sparite anche li. Thunderbird esegue qualche forma di backup automatico/archiviazione che mi permetta il recupero delle mail. Accetto ogni Vs/ cortese suggerimento. Grazie Luciano SACCA'

title: Thunderbird Calendar Entries Displayed Incorrectly on 27/10/2024
content:
In Thunderbird calendar, on 27th Oct 2024, entries added are displayed one hour ahead of where they should be. If the entry is edited, the times are correct, and they show correctly in another calendar app (Calendar on my iPhone). The issue does not occur for events on the day before or the day after, and is the same for a newly added event as for an existing one.

See screen shots. You can see my test event displayed at 11:00 - 12:00 but on editing it is actually 10:00 - 11:00 - the latter is correct.

27th Oct is the day that DST ends in the UK (at 0200) in 2024, but the events are several hours after that.

Nick.
creator: nick225

title: Issue with Uploading Emails to Gmail via Thunderbird (IMAP OAuth2 Authentication)
content:
What is the business impact you are facing?

I am unable to complete the transfer of over 20,000 emails from a Gmail account to a new G Suite account using Thunderbird. This issue is causing significant delays in the migration process, impacting the continuity of communication and data management within the business.

Issue description

I am using Thunderbird to upload emails that were previously downloaded via Google Takeout from a Gmail account to a new G Suite account. The connection to the Gmail IMAP server seems to be correct, as Thunderbird authenticates successfully using OAuth2. However, when attempting to upload the emails, the process stalls. Some emails are uploaded, but many are not, and the upload process stops without providing a clear error message. I need assistance in identifying why Thunderbird is not handling the bulk upload of emails properly and finding a solution to this issue.

Connection details with Google:

â€¢ Server name: imap.gmail.com â€¢ Port: 993 â€¢ Username: ventas@zeusequipos.com â€¢ Authentication method: OAuth2

The connection and authentication work correctly, but the emails do not upload completely.

Is it intermittent or consistent?

The issue is consistent. It occurs every time I attempt to upload emails in bulk.

Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Download emails from a Gmail account using Google Takeout. 2. Attempt to upload the emails to a new G Suite account using Thunderbird. 3. Despite successful authentication and connection with Gmailâ€™s IMAP server, the upload process stalls, and many emails are not uploaded.

Browser

Not applicable (issue occurs in Thunderbird).

Operating system

Windows 10.

Does clearing cookies, cache, and restarting the browser help?

Not applicable (issue occurs in Thunderbird).

Does this issue persist in Thunderbirdâ€™s safe mode?

Yes, the issue persists.

Does this issue persist across different computers?

Yes, I have tried on another machine, and the issue remains.

Does this issue persist across different networks?

Yes, the issue persists on a different network.
creator: jmurilloloaiza
